intro: Catabrosella calvertii, commonly known as the Calvert's catabrosella, is a rare flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in Texas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in open, dry habitats. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
